00041 void runtime_bbnodes(char *filename, double *runtime, int *numbbnodes) {
00042     /* Create and open a pipe to the concorde program. */
00043     FILE *concorde_pipe;
00044     char *command;
00045     asprintf(&command, "concorde %s", filename);
00046     concorde_pipe = popen(command, "r");
00047     if (concorde_pipe == NULL)
00048     {
00049         fprintf(stderr, "Could not open concorde pipe\n");
00050         exit(1);
00051     }
00052 
00053     int nbytes = 810;
00054     char *concorde_output = (char *)malloc(nbytes + 1), *pos;
00055     int bytesread;
00056 
00057     /* Run concorde and get the output */
00058     double rtime = 0;
00059     int bbnodes = 0;
00060     bytesread = getdelim(&concorde_output, &nbytes, "\n\n", concorde_pipe);
00061 
00062     /* I could have used my own timer, but the Concorde program already
00063        outputs this information. So I decided to use their definition of
00064        Concorde's running time.                                          */
00065 
00066     /* If there is no '?' in the output, something went wrong. Since we're
00067        only interested in instances that make it work (and are difficult for it)
00068        we will return 0 and so it has a weak fitness value.                      */
00069     pos = strchr(concorde_output, '?');
00070     if (pos != NULL)
00071         rtime = strtod(pos+1, NULL);
00072 
00073     pos = strchr(concorde_output, '&');
00074     if (pos != NULL)
00075         bbnodes = (int)strtol(pos+1, NULL, 10);
00076 
00077     if (pclose(concorde_pipe) == -1)
00078     {
00079         fprintf(stderr, "Could not close concorde pipe\n");
00080     }
00081     free(concorde_output);
00082 
00083     if (runtime    != NULL) *runtime    = rtime;
00084     if (numbbnodes != NULL) *numbbnodes = bbnodes;
00085 }

00093 int getnum()
00094 {
00095     char text[12];
00096     int num = 0;
00097     if (fgets(text, 12, stdin) != NULL )
00098     {
00099         char *newline = strchr(text, '\n'); /* search for newline character */
00100         if (newline != NULL)
00101         {
00102             *newline = '\0'; /* overwrite trailing newline */
00103         }
00104         num = (int)strtol(text, NULL, 10);
00105     }
00106     return num;
00107 }

00109 
00119 double fastsqrt (double y) {
00120     double x, z, tempf;
00121     unsigned long *tfptr = ((unsigned long *)&tempf) + 1;
00122 
00123     tempf = y;
00124     *tfptr = (0xbfcdd90a - *tfptr)>>1; /* estimate of 1/sqrt(y) */
00125     x =  tempf;
00126     z =  y*0.5;                        /* hoist out the "/2"    */
00127     x = (1.5*x) - (x*x)*(x*z);         /* iteration formula     */
00128     x = (1.5*x) - (x*x)*(x*z);
00129     x = (1.5*x) - (x*x)*(x*z);
00130     x = (1.5*x) - (x*x)*(x*z);
00131     x = (1.5*x) - (x*x)*(x*z);
00132     return x*y;
00133 }

00152 void avg_runtime_bbnodes(char *filename, double *avg_rt, double *sd_rt, double *avg_bb, double *sd_bb, int verbose)
00153 {
00154     int i, j, bb;
00155     double rt, n, Vrt, Vbb, delta_rt, delta_bb;
00156     double _avg_rt, _sd_rt, _avg_bb, _sd_bb;
00157 
00158     n = _avg_rt = _avg_bb = Vrt = Vbb = 0;
00159     for (j = 0; j < NUM_TSP_ITER; j++)
00160     {
00161         runtime_bbnodes(filename, &rt, &bb);
00162         if (verbose) printf("RT%2d: %0.3f\tBB: %d\n", j+1, rt, bb);
00163         n++;
00164 
00165         /* This calculation is used to compute the SD for the average running times. */
00166         delta_rt = rt - _avg_rt;
00167         _avg_rt += delta_rt/n;
00168         Vrt += delta_rt*(rt - _avg_rt); /* NOTE: This expression uses the new value of _avg_rt. */
00169 
00170         /* This calculation is used to compute the SD for the number of branch and bound nodes. */
00171         delta_bb = bb - _avg_bb;
00172         _avg_bb += delta_bb/n;
00173         Vbb += delta_bb*(bb - _avg_bb); /* NOTE: This expression uses the new value of _avg_bb. */
00174     }
00175 
00176     Vrt = Vrt/(n - 1);
00177     Vbb = Vbb/(n - 1);
00178     _sd_rt = fastsqrt(Vrt);
00179     _sd_bb = fastsqrt(Vbb);
00180 
00181     if (avg_rt != NULL) *avg_rt = _avg_rt;
00182     if (avg_bb != NULL) *avg_bb = _avg_bb;
00183     if (sd_rt  != NULL) *sd_rt  = _sd_rt;
00184     if (sd_bb  != NULL) *sd_bb  = _sd_bb;
00185 }

00205 void createTSPFiles(char ***filenames, int **numnodes, int numInstances, const char *lsysfile, const char *lsname)
00206 {
00207     char **fnames  = (char **)malloc(sizeof(char *) * numInstances);
00208     int *num_nodes =   (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)    * numInstances);
00209 
00210     int i;
00211     for (i = 0; i < numInstances; i++)
00212     {
00213         asprintf(&fnames[i], "plot_%d", i+1);
00214 
00215         /* Compute the x-y coordinates of the instance represented by this L-System. */
00216         num_nodes[i] = Lsystem(i + 1, lsysfile, lsname, "plots");
00217 
00218         /* Now create a valid TSPlib file. */
00219         FILE *outfile_stream = fopen(fnames[i], "w");
00220 
00221         /* Check that the file has sucessfully been opened */
00222         if (outfile_stream == NULL)
00223         {
00224             printf("ERROR: File '%s' could not be opened\n", fnames[i]);
00225             return;
00226         }
00227 
00228         /* Build the header file */
00229         fprintf(outfile_stream, "NAME: %s\n", lsname);
00230         fprintf(outfile_stream, "TYPE: TSP\n");
00231         fprintf(outfile_stream, "COMMENT: Created by Farhan Ahammed (farhan.ahammed@studentmail.newcastle.edu.au)\n");
00232         fprintf(outfile_stream, "DIMENSION: %d\n", num_nodes[i]);
00233         fprintf(outfile_stream, "EDGE_WEIGHT_TYPE: EUC_2D\n");
00234         fprintf(outfile_stream, "NODE_COORD_TYPE: TWOD_COORDS\n");
00235         fprintf(outfile_stream, "NODE_COORD_SECTION:\n");
00236 
00237         /* Add the coordinates of the points in this instance. */
00238         FILE *nodefile = fopen("plots", "r");
00239         char line[255];
00240         while(fgets(line, 255, nodefile) != NULL)
00241         {
00242             fprintf(outfile_stream, "%s", line);
00243         }
00244         fclose(nodefile);
00245         remove("plots");
00246 
00247         fprintf(outfile_stream, "EOF:\n");
00248 
00249         /* Close the file */
00250         int close_error_plot = fclose(outfile_stream);
00251         if (close_error_plot)
00252         {
00253             printf("ERROR: File '%s' could not be closed\n", fnames[i]);
00254         }
00255     }
00256 
00257 
00258     (*filenames) = fnames;
00259     (*numnodes) = num_nodes;
00260 }

00273 int createOneTSPFile(char *filename, int order, const char *lsysfile, const char *lsname)
00274 {
00275     /* Compute the x-y coordinates of the instance represented by this L-System. */
00276     int numnodes = Lsystem(order, lsysfile, lsname, "plots");
00277 
00278     /* Now create a valid TSPlib file. */
00279     FILE *outfile_stream = fopen(filename, "w");
00280 
00281     /* Check that the file has sucessfully been opened */
00282     if (outfile_stream == NULL)
00283     {
00284         printf("ERROR: File '%s' could not be opened\n", filename);
00285         return;
00286     }
00287 
00288     /* Build the header file */
00289     fprintf(outfile_stream, "NAME: %s\n", lsname);
00290     fprintf(outfile_stream, "TYPE: TSP\n");
00291     fprintf(outfile_stream, "COMMENT: Created by Farhan Ahammed (farhan.ahammed@studentmail.newcastle.edu.au)\n");
00292     fprintf(outfile_stream, "DIMENSION: %d\n", numnodes);
00293     fprintf(outfile_stream, "EDGE_WEIGHT_TYPE: EUC_2D\n");
00294     fprintf(outfile_stream, "NODE_COORD_TYPE: TWOD_COORDS\n");
00295     fprintf(outfile_stream, "NODE_COORD_SECTION:\n");
00296 
00297     /* Add the coordinates of the points in this instance. */
00298     FILE *nodefile = fopen("plots", "r");
00299     char line[255];
00300     while(fgets(line, 255, nodefile) != NULL)
00301     {
00302         fprintf(outfile_stream, "%s", line);
00303     }
00304     fclose(nodefile);
00305     remove("plots");
00306 
00307     fprintf(outfile_stream, "EOF:\n");
00308 
00309     /* Close the file */
00310     int close_error_plot = fclose(outfile_stream);
00311     if (close_error_plot)
00312     {
00313         printf("ERROR: File '%s' could not be closed\n", filename);
00314     }
00315 
00316     return numnodes;
00317 }

00329 void find_fitness(const char *filename, const char *lsname)
00330 {
00331 
00332     int *instancesize;
00333     char **filenames;
00334     double avg_rt, sd_rt, avg_bb, sd_bb;
00335 
00336     createTSPFiles(&filenames, &instancesize, NUM_TEST_INSTANCES, filename, lsname);
00337 
00338     /* Create a plot of the running times. */
00339     int i;
00340     data_point points[NUM_TEST_INSTANCES];
00341     printf("Creating instances of different sizes and running Concorde on them\n");
00342     printf("Order\tInstance Size\tAvg. Run Time\tAvg. BB Nodes\n----------------------------------------------------------------------\n");
00343     fflush(stdout);
00344     for (i = 0; i < NUM_TEST_INSTANCES; i++)
00345     {
00346         printf(" %d\t %d\t\t", i+1, instancesize[i]);
00347         fflush(stdout);
00348 
00349         avg_runtime_bbnodes(filenames[i], &avg_rt, &sd_rt, &avg_bb, &sd_bb, 0);
00350 
00351         printf(" %7.4f (%7.4f)\t%7.4f (%7.4f)\n", avg_rt, sd_rt, avg_bb, sd_bb);
00352         fflush(stdout);
00353 
00354         points[i].x = instancesize[i];
00355         points[i].y = avg_rt;
00356 
00357         free(filenames[i]);
00358     }
00359     free(instancesize);
00360     free(filenames);
00361     system("rm -f Oplot* plot*");
00362     printf("\n");
00363 
00364     /* Compute the upper bound of the running times of the plots of different sizes. */
00365     double func[NUM_TEST_INSTANCES];
00366 
00367     int offset = 0;
00368     while ((points[offset].x < 60) || (points[offset].y == 0)) offset++;
00369     offset--;
00370 
00371     /* We might not like too many (x,0) points, but we need to have at least
00372        three points to compute the upper bound. */
00373     if (NUM_TEST_INSTANCES - offset < 3) offset = NUM_TEST_INSTANCES - 3;
00374 
00375     find_upper_bound(func, points+offset, NUM_TEST_INSTANCES-offset);
00376     printf("data points bounded above by:\n\ty =  %0.4f + %0.4f((x - %0.4f)/%0.4f)^(%0.6f)\n", func[2], func[4], func[1], func[3], func[0]);
00377     printf("\n");
00378 
00379     /* Compute the sum of errors. */
00380     double se = sum_error(func, points+offset, NUM_TEST_INSTANCES-offset);
00381     printf("SE: %f\n", se);
00382 
00383     printf("Fitness: %0.4f^2/%0.4f = %0.4f", func[0], se+1, (func[0]*func[0])/(se+1));
00384 
00385     int order, instsize;
00386     double pred;
00387     char response;
00388     int finished = 0;
00389 
00390     do
00391     {
00392         printf("\nEnter an order: ");
00393         order = getnum();
00394 
00395         instsize = createOneTSPFile("tempfile", order, filename, lsname);
00396         pred = func[2] + func[4]*pow((instsize - func[1])/func[3], func[0]);
00397         printf("Prediction: %0.4fs\n", pred);
00398 
00399         printf("\nPress enter to run Concorde\n");
00400         getchar();
00401         printf("\n");
00402         system("concorde tempfile");
00403 
00404         printf("\nRun again? ");
00405         response = getchar();
00406         finished = ((response != 'y') && (response != 'Y')) ;
00407 
00408         /* For some reason, fflush(stdin) doesn't work. I need to use getchar() to
00409            remove the '\n'. */
00410         while (getchar() != '\n') {}
00411     } while (!finished);
00412     remove("tempfile");
00413 }

00417 void find_runtime(const char *filename, const char *lsname)
00418 {
00419     int order, numcities;
00420     char text[4], *tspname = "temp.tsp";
00421     double avg_rt, sd_rt, avg_bb, sd_bb;
00422 
00423 
00424     printf("Which order do you want to test? ");
00425     order = getnum();
00426 
00427     printf("order: %d\n", order); fflush(stdout);
00428 
00429     numcities = createOneTSPFile(tspname, order, filename, lsname);
00430     printf("Number of Cities: %d\n", numcities); fflush(stdout);
00431 
00432     avg_runtime_bbnodes(tspname, &avg_rt, &sd_rt, &avg_bb, &sd_bb, 1);
00433     system("mv *.sol solution");
00434     system("rm *plot* *temp*");
00435     printf("\n");
00436 
00437     printf("Running Times:\n");
00438     printf("Average: %0.4f\n", avg_rt);
00439     printf("St. Dev: %0.4f\n",  sd_rt);
00440     printf("68%% lies within:  (%7.4f, %7.4f)\n", avg_rt -   sd_rt, avg_rt +   sd_rt);
00441     printf("95%% lies within:  (%7.4f, %7.4f)\n", avg_rt - 2*sd_rt, avg_rt + 2*sd_rt);
00442     printf("\n");
00443 
00444     printf("Number of Branch and Bound Nodes:\n");
00445     printf("Average: %0.4f\n", avg_bb);
00446     printf("St. Dev: %0.4f\n",  sd_bb);
00447     printf("68%% lies within:  (%7.4f, %7.4f)\n", avg_bb -   sd_bb, avg_bb +   sd_bb);
00448     printf("95%% lies within:  (%7.4f, %7.4f)\n", avg_bb - 2*sd_bb, avg_bb + 2*sd_bb);
00449 }

00454 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00455 {
00456     char text[4];
00457     int choice;
00458 
00459     if (argc != 3)
00460     {
00461         printf("usage:\n%s <L-System file> <L-System name>", argv[0]);
00462         return 0;
00463     }
00464 
00465     printf("Do you want to:\n");
00466     printf("[1] Find an upper bound and compute the fitness, or\n");
00467     printf("[2] Find the average running time for an instance size, or\n");
00468     printf("[3] Exit?\n");
00469     fflush(stdout);
00470 
00471     choice = getnum();
00472 
00473     int finished = 0, ch;
00474     char response;
00475     switch (choice)
00476     {
00477         case 1:
00478             find_fitness(argv[1], argv[2]);
00479             break;
00480         case 2:
00481 
00482             do
00483             {
00484                 find_runtime(argv[1], argv[2]);
00485 
00486                 printf("\nRun again? ");
00487                 response = getchar();
00488                 finished = ((response != 'y') && (response != 'Y'));
00489 
00490                 while (((ch = getchar()) != EOF) && ((char)ch != '\n'));
00491             } while (!finished);
00492             break;
00493     }
00494 
00495     return 0;
00496 }
